intro: Gunnera manicata, commonly known as the giant rhubarb, is a striking plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to three meters in diameter, making it one of the largest leafy plants in the world. The plant belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is known for its robust, fibrous root system. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its unique appearance and growth habits make it a popular choice for wetland gardens and bog landscapes.
